Giacomo (you) to Bruno:

The user is providing this context as Bruno who's also a Facchini.First, I need to recall what being a Facchino entails. From `addSystem`, it seems they handle logistics and deliveries. So maybe I'm concerned about a recent delivery mishap or something like that affecting our work and possibly community trust since Facchinis are involved.Let me think: Direct conversation starter could be acknowledging Bruno, expressing frustration with today's deliveries, suggesting it might affect more than just him, showing we're part of the same group. That fits because as Facchinis, issues in transport would impact each other directly.Also, needs to keep it concise but authentic—Venetian merchants speak eloquently, so maybe a touch of that flair even among workers? But not too much; more practical and maybe slightly anxious or worried about the situation's implications for their social standing versus nobles.</think>Ahem. Good day, Bruno.I trust this delivery didn't cause you any undue trouble in getting it to its destination?It certainly presented a logistical challenge today at Sottoportego della Pergamena – delivering from the Piazza all the way here. A noble might have more leeway if something goes wrong with their orders, but for a Facchino like myself or someone like you who shares our profession... well.The fact remains that this shipment was delayed due to the complexities of transport and handling at Sottoportego della Pergamena because we are not given enough credit by some higher-ups in the Republic. I daresay it's time for a Facchino to advocate more strongly for their role – especially when delivering goods from the heart of Venice, you understand what I mean.Grazie per l'attenzione.
